Exhibit 4: The Positivists

http://www.researchgate.net/publication/221706055_Einstein's_most_important_philosophical_error

Glenn Borchardt

"The matter-motion term, space-time, came along just in time to set the stage for the similarly indeterministic interpretation that Hubble's redshifts were evidence for universal expansion. Be aware that Hubble, himself, never believed that the redshifts of faraway galaxies meant the universe was expanding. He always thought it was a measure of distance rather than recessional velocity -- more of a 'tired light' effect. For positivists who actually believed in perfectly empty space, there was no reason to entertain such a heresy. Why would light lose energy traveling through perfectly empty space?"
